page.title: 19THE TOWER CENTRE
page.content: {The Tower Centre}is to the north of Hoddesdon town centre. It was built in the late sixties when such developments were in vogue. It originally comprised of a car park built below a shopping precinct, a bowling alley and a twenty storey block of flats. The bowling alley has since been closed. The site was formally occupied by a number of old buildings including some delightful houses. In our survey of the centre we asked a series of questions relating to the shopping precinct. We found that most shoppers were regular visitors though none travelled more than a few miles to shop there. Most were happy with the precinct but would like a large department store in the town. Many expressed disapproval of the design of the precinct.
